cs015.prj.FruitNinjaSupport

Class CS15Fruit

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs015.prj.FruitNinjaSupport.CS15Fruit

  • public abstract class CS15Fruit
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class that models a fruit that can be added to the game. You must make a subclass of CS15Fruit using this class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CS15Fruit()
      The constructor that initializes the fruit.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void chopGraphically()
      Graphically chops the fruit by making the fruit image appear more transparent. This is implemented for you, just think of when to call it.
      java.lang.String getImage()
      Allows you to choose an image (represented by a String path to a file). This is not abstract, but you should still override it so each of your fruit has its own image. (Hint: check out the Constants class for help with this).
      void ripen()
      Graphically makes fruits appear less shrunken. This is implemented for you, just think of when to call it.
      void splash()
      Creates a splash on the screen at the fruit's last position. This is implemented for you, just think of when to call it.
      void wash()
      Graphically makes the fruit appear less dirty. This is implemented for you, just think of when to call it.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • getImage

        public java.lang.String getImage()
        Allows you to chose an image (represented by a String path to a file). This is not abstract, but you should still override it so each of your fruits has its own image. (Hint: check out the Constants class for help with this)
        Returns:
        a String representing the path to the image file
